snippet: A German man who pretended to be an Iraqi Army general and often boasted of his political and diplomatic connections was convicted Thursday of killing his 91-year-old wife, a socialite and journalist.
abstract: Washington man Albrecht Muth, 49-year-old German who pretended to be an Iraqi Army general and often boasted of his political and diplomatic connections, is convicted of killing his 91-year-old wife Viola Drath in what prosecutors say was an inheritance scheme.
lead_paragraph: A German man who pretended to be an Iraqi Army general and often boasted of his political and diplomatic connections was convicted Thursday of killing his 91-year-old wife, a socialite and journalist.
